body:
$! You must tell DVLA if you suffer from psychotic depression.$!

% You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted. %

##Car or motorcycle licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form M1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D [Download ‘M1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 252KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066650.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"} $D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form M1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D [Download ‘M1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 243KB)](
http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_172725.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"} $D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have psychotic depression - download the correct form to let them know
title: Psychotic depression and driving
